channel.title: Coordinate clicking
channel.description:
Is there a command that tells the script to wait until a page is done loading?
~r4z0rlike

item.title: Coordinate clicking
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Aftermath_96:

It would be easier to see if a page is done loading than to look for a color on the loaded page.

Yeah i guess your right.

offtopic: woah doomsday got banned? i saw this coming

Read full topic

item.title: Coordinate clicking
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

Here is how you do it,

use the color picker and get a color when the page is loaded

then at the top of your script(where you want it to wait for the script) right this.

repeat
wait(1)
until(getcolor(the x cord, the y cord)=thecolor)

dont forget to fill in teh x and y cord, and the color.

Read full topic

item.title: Coordinate clicking

item.title: Coordinate clicking
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Aftermath_96:

Actually, that will wait until it FINDS the color.

Isnt that what he wanted? It waits until it finds a particular color in a particular location. which he should pick a color that is visible when the page loads.

Read full topic

item.title: Coordinate clicking
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Actually, that will wait until it FINDS the color.

Put this with your procedures.
function IsLoading: Boolean;
begin
Result := False;
if(GetColor(230, 233))and
(GetColor(230, 266))and
(GetColor(533, 233))and
(GetColor(533, 266))=1118604 then
Result := True;
end;

And when you want it to make sure it’s not loading,
Do
if(not(IsLoading))Then
Do({Continue with your script here}

and make an else that repeats waiting until not(IsLoading)

Function by Freddy1990.

Read full topic

item.title: Coordinate clicking
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“n00bkill, post:2, topic:4122”]maybe you can put

if(findColor(x, y, color, x1, y1, x2, y2))then

then after that put in what u want it to do when it finds the b/g color might work

lol if it doesnt sorry, i am new to SCAR :|[/quote]

I think that will just check if it finds the color and even if it doesnt it will just move on. In my opinion your best option here is one of the folowing two:

wait(3000+random(400)) change 3000 to the time in miliseconds that you think it will take to load the page. or (i dont know if this will work) try this:

procedure waitforpagetoload;
begin
repeat
wait(1000)
until(getcolor(color,x,y))
end;

That should keep checking for ‘color’ at ‘x,y’ and when it finds it the procedure will finish. Basicly put that procedure in your script right after you want it to wait for the page to load.

Read full topic
